definitions: legendary being with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse
examples: The centaur galloped through the enchanted forest swiftly
Ancient Greek pottery often depicted centaurs in battle scenes

definitions: commemoration marking one hundred years since a significant event or founding
examples: The university celebrated its centenary with special exhibitions
The town's centenary festivities lasted an entire week

definitions: celebration or observance marking one hundred years of an event or institution
examples: The museum planned special events for its centennial year
Colorado's centennial celebration honored its statehood in 1876

definitions: point equidistant from all sides or edges of something
building or place dedicated to a particular activity or service
main point of attention, activity, or interest in a situation
examples: The fountain stands at the center of the plaza
Draw a circle with its center at these coordinates
The community center offers swimming and fitness classes
They visited the shopping center to buy new clothes
She became the center of attention at the party
The scandal was at the center of the investigation

definitions: double-page spread in the center of a magazine, often featuring photographs
examples: The magazine's centerfold featured stunning landscape photography
She unfolded the centerfold to reveal the detailed map

definitions: act or process of placing something at the center or middle position
examples: The centering of the text improved the document's appearance
Proper centering ensures the wheel spins without wobbling

definitions: line marking the center of a road, field, or other divided area
examples: Drivers must not cross the solid yellow centerline
The referee placed the ball on the field's centerline

definitions: decorative object placed at the center of a dining table
most important or attractive feature of something
examples: The floral centerpiece brightened the entire dining room
They created an ice sculpture centerpiece for the wedding
The new park became the centerpiece of urban renewal
Her research formed the centerpiece of the conference

definitions: metric unit of length equal to one hundredth of a meter
examples: The pencil measures exactly fifteen centimeters in length
Each square on the grid represents one centimeter

definitions: metric unit of length equal to one hundredth of a meter
examples: The fabric was cut to ninety centimetres exactly
The gap measured only two centimetres wide

definitions: elongated arthropod with numerous legs arranged in pairs along its segments
examples: A centipede scurried across the bathroom floor quickly
The giant centipede can grow over twelve inches long

definitions: main office or headquarters of an organization or system
examples: Please report the incident to central immediately
The police central dispatched units to the scene

definitions: process of bringing activities or powers under a single central authority or control
examples: The centralisation of services reduced administrative costs significantly
Critics argued that centralisation stifled local innovation

definitions: quality of being central or of primary importance to something
examples: The centrality of education to economic development is undeniable
Her work emphasized the centrality of family relationships

definitions: process of concentrating control of activities or organizations under a single authority
examples: The company's centralization strategy improved operational efficiency
Political centralization often reduces regional autonomy

definitions: point equidistant from all sides or edges of something
building or place dedicated to a particular activity or service
main point of attention, activity, or interest in a situation
examples: The monument stands at the centre of the square
Mark the centre of the circle with a dot
The leisure centre offers various sports and activities
They met at the shopping centre for lunch
London remains the centre of British financial markets
The dispute was at the centre of negotiations

definitions: decorative object placed at the center of a dining table
most important or prominent feature of something
examples: The crystal centrepiece sparkled in the candlelight beautifully
Fresh flowers made a simple but elegant centrepiece
The new stadium is the centrepiece of regeneration plans
This policy forms the centrepiece of their manifesto

definitions: act or process of placing something at the center or middle position
examples: The centring of the image required careful adjustment
Proper centring prevents vibration in rotating machinery

definitions: person who holds moderate political views between left and right extremes
examples: The centrist candidate appealed to voters from both parties
Many centrists advocate for pragmatic, compromise-based solutions

definitions: professional officer in the ancient Roman army commanding approximately one hundred soldiers
examples: The centurion led his men into battle with discipline
Roman centurions were known for their military expertise

definitions: period of one hundred consecutive years
score of one hundred runs by a single batsman in cricket
examples: The castle has stood for over five centuries
Major technological advances marked the twentieth century
The batsman scored his first test century yesterday
She celebrated her century with raised bat triumphantly

definitions: object made from clay and hardened by heat, such as pottery or tiles
hard, brittle material made by heating clay or similar substances
examples: The museum displayed ancient Greek ceramics and pottery
She collected handmade ceramics from local artisans
The bathroom features ceramic tiles in various colors
Ceramic materials withstand extremely high temperatures well

definitions: artist or craftsperson who specializes in creating ceramic objects and pottery
examples: The ceramicist demonstrated wheel-throwing techniques at the workshop
Local ceramicists displayed their work at the craft fair

definitions: person who makes ceramic objects, especially as an artist or craftsperson
examples: The ceramist shaped the clay with practiced hands
Several ceramists shared the communal kiln for firing

definitions: processed grain food typically eaten with milk for breakfast
grass plant cultivated for its edible grain, such as wheat or oats
examples: The children ate cereal with fresh fruit every morning
She poured milk over her favorite chocolate cereal
Farmers rotate cereal crops to maintain soil health
Wheat remains the most important cereal crop globally

definitions: formal religious or public occasion marked by ritual observances and traditional procedures
examples: The ceremonial included ancient prayers and symbolic offerings
Military ceremonials honor fallen soldiers with solemn dignity

definitions: formal religious or public occasion celebrating a particular event or achievement
formal polite behavior required by social conventions
examples: The graduation ceremony lasted nearly three hours
They planned an outdoor ceremony for their wedding
The ambassador was received with great ceremony
Let's dispense with ceremony and speak frankly

definitions: informal term for a certificate or certification document
examples: She needs her teaching cert before starting work
The safety cert expires at the end of December

definitions: firm conviction that something is the case without doubt
fact or situation that is definitely true or will definitely happen
examples: She spoke with absolute certainty about the results
Mathematical proofs provide certainty through logical deduction
Death and taxes remain the only certainties in life
His promotion next year seems like a certainty

definitions: official document attesting to a fact, qualification, or completion of requirements
examples: She received her certificate after completing the course
The birth certificate lists the time and place of birth

definitions: official process of confirming that something meets required standards or qualifications
document proving that someone or something has been officially certified
examples: The certification process ensures all products meet safety standards
Professional certification requires passing a comprehensive examination
She proudly displayed her certification on the office wall
The organic certification guarantees pesticide-free production methods

definitions: deep blue color resembling a clear sky
examples: The artist mixed cerulean with white for the clouds
Her dress was a stunning shade of cerulean

definitions: fact or process of ending or being brought to an end
examples: The cessation of hostilities brought relief to civilians
Immediate cessation of smoking improves cardiovascular health significantly

definitions: formal giving up of rights, property, or territory by a state
examples: The treaty required the cession of disputed border territories
The cession of Alaska to America occurred in 1867

definitions: small piece of paper or card removed when a hole is punched
examples: Hanging chads complicated the ballot counting process significantly
The floor was littered with paper chads from hole-punching

definitions: dry husks of grain separated during threshing
worthless things or matter compared to what is valuable
examples: The wind blew the chaff away from the wheat
Farmers traditionally burned chaff after the harvest season
Editors must separate literary chaff from genuine talent
The report contained mostly chaff with little substance

definitions: feeling of disappointment, annoyance, or embarrassment caused by failure or humiliation
examples: Much to her chagrin, she forgot her prepared speech
He expressed chagrin at missing the important deadline

definitions: series of connected metal links or rings
group of stores or businesses owned by one company
sequence of connected events, actions, or things
examples: The dog's chain rattled against the fence post
She wore a delicate gold chain around her neck
The restaurant chain operates in fifteen different countries
Major retail chains dominate the shopping district
The chain of events led to unexpected consequences
Breaking the chain of infection requires proper hygiene

definitions: portable mechanical saw with teeth on a chain that moves around a guide bar
examples: The lumberjack started his chainsaw with one pull
Safety gear is essential when operating a chainsaw

definitions: piece of furniture with a back and seat for one person
position of authority as the person who leads meetings or committees
senior academic position as head of a university department
examples: She pulled up a chair to join the conversation
The antique chair needed new upholstery
The board elected her chair of the finance committee
As chair, he maintained order during heated debates
Professor Smith holds the chair in molecular biology
The university endowed a new chair in ethics

definitions: series of chairs suspended from a moving cable used to carry skiers up a mountain
examples: The chairlift carried skiers to the mountain summit
They shared the chairlift with two other snowboarders

definitions: man who presides over a meeting, committee, board, or organization
examples: The chairman called the board meeting to order
He served as chairman for three consecutive terms

definitions: position or period of being chairman of an organization or committee
examples: During his chairmanship, the company doubled its profits
She assumed the chairmanship of the education committee

definitions: person who presides over a meeting, committee, or organization
examples: The chairperson announced the meeting agenda items clearly
They elected a new chairperson by unanimous vote

definitions: woman who presides over a meeting, committee, board, or organization
examples: The chairwoman guided the discussion with diplomatic skill
She became the first chairwoman in the organization's history

definitions: long chair with a back support and extended seat for reclining
examples: She relaxed on the chaise by the swimming pool
The Victorian chaise needed complete reupholstering

definitions: wooden house with overhanging eaves, typical of Swiss Alpine regions
examples: They rented a cozy chalet for their ski vacation
The mountain chalet offered stunning views of the valley

definitions: large cup or goblet, typically used for drinking wine in religious ceremonies
examples: The priest raised the silver chalice during communion
The medieval chalice was decorated with precious gems

definitions: soft white limestone substance used for writing or drawing
soft white sedimentary rock composed mainly of calcium carbonate
examples: The teacher wrote equations on the board with chalk
Children drew hopscotch squares with colored chalk
The white cliffs contain layers of ancient chalk
Chalk deposits formed from microscopic marine organisms

definitions: dark surface, typically green or black, for writing on with chalk
examples: The professor filled the entire chalkboard with equations
Students took turns writing answers on the chalkboard
